title: Access is denied when renaming file during staged Sync + large RAM usage
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: 2022.99.99-dev-c66bde2d

OS & Version: Windows 10

Commit hash : 1e3ad39202bce335e7ec122f6242e6d4a75efabc

#### Expected behaviour

Successful snap-sync of Ethereum mainnet with a RAM consumption of less than 4 Gb

#### Actual behaviour

Yesterday, my erigon client made it past the phase where it downloads the 200+ Gb snapshot. I then shut it down using ctrl + c. Now, a day later, when I run erigon I get stuck at an error message shortly after startup saying access is denied when attempting to rename xxx-hearders.idx.tmp files to xxx-headers.idx. This error message repeats forever and prevents the client from syncing.

Another issue I have with the client is that it consumes an enormous amount of RAM. According to the github readme, erigon should use about 4 Gb of RAM during sync and about 1 Gb during normal work. But my client uses way more than that, generally between 8 - 14 Gb.

This is the way I run the client:

`erigon --syncmode=snap --datadir=D:\ETH_mainnet_erigon --port=0 --torrent.port=30303`

Here are the logs when I run it:

```
INFO[05-20|14:28:33.046] Build info                               git_branch=devel git_tag=v2021.10.03-1106-g1e3ad3920 git_commit=1e3ad39202bce335e7ec122f6242e6d4a75efabc
INFO[05-20|14:28:33.047] Starting Erigon on Ethereum mainnet...

INFO[05-20|14:28:35.561] Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 1 Homestead: 1150000 DAO: 1920000 DAOSupport: true EIP150: 2463000 EIP155: 2675000 EIP158: 2675000 Byzantium: 4370000 Constantinople: 7280000 Petersburg: 7280000 Istanbul: 9069000, Muir Glacier: 9200000, Berlin: 12244000, London: 12965000, Arrow Glacier: 13773000, Terminal Total Difficulty: <nil>, Engine: ethash}" genesis=0xd4e56740f876aef8c010b86a40d5f56745a118d0906a34e69aec8c0db1cb8fa3
INFO[05-20|14:28:37.560] Disk storage enabled for ethash DAGs     dir=D:\\ETH_mainnet_erigon\\ethash-dags count=2

EROR[05-20|14:31:05.524] Staged Sync                              err="[1/16 Headers] HeadersIdx: rename D:\\ETH_mainnet_erigon\\snapshots\\v1-008500-009000-headers.idx.tmp D:\\ETH_mainnet_erigon\\snapshots\\v1-008500-009000-headers.idx: Access is denied."
INFO[05-20|14:31:06.029] [Snapshots] Fetching torrent files metadata
```

Things to check 
1) Run task manager and verify no other instances of erigon.exe are running. If it's the case kill them
2) Have you initial ran erigon from a command prompt of from a **powershell** prompt ? (this is relevant as in command prompt ctrl-c may not be intercepted by erigon whilest the OS simply closes the command window)
3) Have you originally ran erigon with admin privileges ? And now under normal user ? If it's the case the files created by admin user cannot be renamed by normal user as the latter does not have the rights to do that)
4) Have you tried reboot ?

> 



> Things to check
> 
> 1. Run task manager and verify no other instances of erigon.exe are running. If it's the case kill them
> 2. Have you initial ran erigon from a command prompt of from a **powershell** prompt ? (this is relevant as in command prompt ctrl-c may not be intercepted by erigon whilest the OS simply closes the command window)
> 3. Have you originally ran erigon with admin privileges ? And now under normal user ? If it's the case the files created by admin user cannot be renamed by normal user as the latter does not have the rights to do that)
> 4. Have you tried reboot ?

1) I have checked the task manager and only one erigon.exe instance is running.

2) I use a .bat file that starts erigon from the command prompt. I used the .bat file both when I initially started erigon to download the snapshot and now when I run it. When I built erigon.exe however, I used powershell. This is the content of the .bat file:

```
cd D:\erigon\build\bin
erigon --syncmode=snap --datadir=D:\ETH_mainnet_erigon --port=0 --torrent.port=30303
pause
```

3) When I built erigon.exe in Powershell I used admin privileges, but after that I always run erigon in a regular, non-admin, command prompt using the .bat file. I have just now also tried to start erigon from a command prompt with admin privileges, but I got the same error message.

4) Yes I have tried to reboot.

What are permissions on this file and directory?
 D:\\ETH_mainnet_erigon\\snapshots\\v1-008500-009000-headers.idx.tmp

Above you see logs like: 
WARN[05-20|14:28:40.662] [RecvMessage] sentry not ready yet       err="could not start server: listen udp [::]:58202: bind: An attempt was made to access a socket in a way forbidden by its access permissions."

Which also tell you about permission errors to listen port 
Or something wrong with your machine, or you run multiple erigons, or your use has no permissions to all this things
This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
This issue was closed because it has been stalled for 7 days with no activity.
